alert.note: Alert for Wabasha (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 12 at 12:25AM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Wabasha County through 115 AM CDT... At 1224 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Mazeppa, or 18 miles north of Rochester, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northwestern Wabasha County, including the following locations... Rattelsnake Point, Oak Center, Bluff Valley Campground, Maple Springs, Gilbert Valley, Zumbro Falls, West Albany, Bear Valley. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
